snippet: Viswanathan Anand, the world champion, made a rare visit last month to the United States, where he taught chess classes and participated in a simultaneous exhibition against 20 players.
abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain Chess column notes that world champion Viswanathan Anand has made a rare visit to the United States, where he taught chess classes and participated in a simultaneous exhibition against 20 players.
lead_paragraph: Viswanathan Anand, the world champion, made a rare visit last month to the United States, where he taught chess classes and participated in a simultaneous exhibition against 20 players.

headline.seo: Chess: Anand Brings His Game to the U.S.
